column4: >> I have opened the menu.lst file inside my /boot/grub folder... what i need to do is change the kernel/OS that is selected by default while booting! how??
what do you want to do?
sudo update-grub
read the output
don't flood here, learn about pastebin
interesting, you build those kernels?
better to keep default 0 , it might be confusing later, if you change it to default 2
you can not, but you can press "e" to edit (for this booting), or "c" to command line
flightgears

what fps ?
something like quake 2 or something
I don't know :( you may try googling " linux games "
